items.question: How much does a lawyer cost?
items.answer: Injury cases are contingency fee based. Other matters offer flat or hourly rates with transparent billing.

items.question: What is a contingency fee?
items.answer: You pay nothing upfront. We only collect a fee if we secure compensation for you.

items.question: How long will my case take?
items.answer: Timelines vary. Many cases resolve in 3-9 months, but complex litigation can take longer.

items.question: Should I accept the insurance company's offer?
items.answer: Never settle without legal advice. Insurance companies often undervalue claims.

items.question: Will my case go to trial?
items.answer: Most cases settle, but we prepare every case as if it is going to trial so we are ready.

items.question: What should I bring to my consultation?
items.answer: Bring any contracts, police reports, medical records, or correspondence related to your case.

items.question: How often will you communicate with me?
items.answer: You will receive regular updates via phone, email, or portal, and you can reach us anytime.

items.question: Do you handle cases outside [City]?
items.answer: Yes - we represent clients statewide and partner with trusted counsel for national matters.
